articles provide a more comprehensive guide to visiting those cities.

The Games of the XXII Winter Olympiad, the

to be more specific.  The official 16 days of the games will be 7-23 February 2014, although some events will start before the official opening ceremonies.

The games will be followed two weeks later by the Winter Paralympic Games, 7-18 Mar 2014. Most of the paralympic events will be held in the same Olympic venues.

value: File:Opening of XXII Winter Olympic Games (2338-13).jpg
At the Opening Ceremony for the XXII Olympic Winter Games.

2014 Sochi Olympic Games Committee has prepared an official application that contains all the required information on the venues, the torch relay, competition information and getting around from one cluster to the other. You can download it from
Tickets can be bought on the

.

Please be aware that along with the ticket you will need to have a
General information about travelling to Sochi is in the
article. All types of transportation, including trains, buses, air flights, and cruise ships, will be adding services during the Olympic period to meet the expected heavy demand.

value: A Panoramic view of the 2014 Sochi Olympic Park.

The rail network links the Olympic Park, Adler, Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana to connect with the mountain venues. Allow
for getting to the Olympic Park from Sochi, and 80 minutes to Krasnaya Polyana.
During the Olympics, special parking and driving restrictions will be in place around most Olympic areas. Penalties for illegal parking will be increased dramatically during the Olympics.
Olympic and Paralympic ticket holders can use
to get to the venues from the main districts in Sochi.
There are two clusters for venues:

value: Olympic Park from the International Space Station

Olympic park in the Coastal cluster includes following venues:

value: content=40,000 seats, named after the 2,867m high mountain Fisht. Venue for opening and closing ceremonies, medal ceremonies. Later it will be used as a football stadium for the 2018 World Cup.
content=7,000 seats. The Arena can be dismantled after the games and re-erected elsewhere.
content=multi-functional hall with 3,000 seats can be moved to another location.
content=After the games, the Arena will be moved to another city and serve as exhibition hall.
Hotel for Olympic and Paralympic family
Aerial view of mountain facilities under construction in May 2013

The Mountain Cluster will include Biathlon and Ski Complexes, a Bobsleigh Track, a Ski Center, a Ski Jump Complex, as well as a Snowboard Park and Freestyle Center.

Due to deals with a major sponsor, the only card that can be used inside the Olympic Park and at other venues is Visa. Cash can also be used.

directions=Coastal Cluster: 35km, 30 minutes distance drive; Mountain Cluster: 70km, 60 minutes distance drive
Be aware that the border of Russia with

is considered a "prohibited zone" from 10 days before the start of the Olympics until 5 days after the end of the Paralympic games. It is not clear whether foreigners will be able to cross the border and enter (and return to) Abkhazia during this time.
